climbs.name: Brinton’s Arete Left V3/V6 sit
climbs.fa: EZ? See below -- possibly Anna Boatman on the low sit.

content.description:
For the sit, start on the left side of the arete, with a low downpulling crimp for the left hand and a gaston for the right.  Climb the left side of the arete.  A sustained and pretty darn good problem with a quite a good landing.

 For the stand, just stand.  It’s a sweet problem.

 From a previous description by Peter Erard in 2007 : "The crux would be the second move from a standing start. What's bad about it? The hands, barely any handholds. When there are handholds, they're non-existent. Semi-sharp edges leading into a slopy two-finger edge. From there, finish on top with a solid bomber hold."
content.protection: A couple pads, maybe a spot.  There is a mantle finish.
content.location: Just below the classic route, Brinton’s Crack.

content.description: A shaded rock at the base of the East Rampart
